opcode

Class EncounterHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • opcode.EncounterHandler

  • public class EncounterHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the class that runs each and every encounter in this combat system. It makes use of two Entity ArrayLists and some loops to do so.

    Much of this class is static, as I wanted it to be usable without needing to create an instance of the class in the file someone would be working in.

    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EncounterHandler()
      The default constructor of the EncounterHandler class constructs the defaultencounter ArrayList.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void defaultRun()
      This method runs an encounter containing a new Char and new Orc object.
      static void run(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> enc)
      This method runs an ArrayList of Entitys by making use of various other private methods and a while loop.
      static void run(Entity[] enc)
      This method converts an inputted Entity Array into an ArrayList, then uses the .run() method on it.

        public static void defaultRun()
        This method runs an encounter containing a new Char and new Orc object.
        See Also:

      • run

        public static void run(Entity[] enc)
        This method converts an inputted Entity Array into an ArrayList, then uses the .run() method on it.
        Parameters:
        enc - the array of Entitys to be run.
        See Also:
        run(ArrayList)

      • run

        public static void run(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> enc)
        This method runs an ArrayList of Entitys by making use of various other private methods and a while loop. While the mainchar lives, the while loop will not close, although it will be force-broken if the totaldeaths ArrayList size is one less than the encounter's size.
        Parameters:
        enc - The new encounter arrayList to be run.
        See Also:
        startEncounter(ArrayList), calcXP(ArrayList), cleanup()
